values.label: Does your baby require neck support?
Does your baby close his fist when an object is placed in his/her hand?
Remains Alert 15-30% of the Time. Sleeps a significant part of the day.
Presence of All Primitive Reflexes. Involuntary movements that help them navigate early life e.g., sucking, palmar, grasp, plantar, Moro's, rooting, etc.
Is your baby ticklish on the sole of the foot?
Does your baby suck anything that touches his/her mouth?
Does your baby have reflex when there is sudden loss of support?
Your baby turns his head towards anything that strokes his/her head?
Expects regular feeding intervals.
Deliberately cries to ask for help.
Does your baby produce high pitch noises?
Communicates Through Crying. Whimpers and cries are the primary means of communication.
How does your baby react to faces and objects? interested/not interested
Perceives light, its intensity and movement.
Perceives changes in temperatures.
Sleeping, crying and eating patterns are still disorganized.
Does your baby respond to voices and try to look at the person talking?
Does your baby extend arms and hands?
Baby tries to maintain his/her head upright for a few seconds?
Grabs other’s fingers if they put in the palm of the baby?
Does your baby move closed hands towards objects?
Your baby opens his/her hands if an object is put in the palm and automatically closes it?
Your baby studies and explores the movements of hands?
did your child start developing a variety of  coos and gurgles?
Your baby identifies human voice from other different sounds?
Does your baby make eye contact?
Is your baby startled to certain noises?
Identifies Human Voice, can differentiate  from other sounds.
Does your baby react to the presence of a person by moving hands and legs,gesturing or heavily breathing?
Your child expresses emotions like anxiety, pleasure and excitement?
Does your child prefer people over objects?
Does your baby lift head for a few seconds?
Does your child apply pressure when feet are against something firm?.
Is you baby able to make a variety of head and neck movements?
Does your baby attempt to lean on forearms when lying on stomach?
Your baby does vigorous hands and legs movements?
Does your baby like to be carried and maintained in an upright position?
Your baby’s palms stay open for longer periods??
Opens and closes hands.
Your baby hits objects hanging near fingertips?
Does your baby bring his/her hands to mouth?
Does your child express interest or excitement about something?
Your baby reacts to sounds with a combination of sighs,coos and gurgles?
does your baby look from where the sound is coming from by turning head and neck?
Your baby looks at people’s faces with increased attention?
Is your baby looking at the bottle while sucking it simultaneously?
Pays attention to voices and unfamiliar noises.
Does your baby enjoy it when someone sings?
Your child stops sucking or other activities to listen to new sounds?
Does your baby extend arms towards the bottle or breast?
Your child seeks attention when parents are around?
Your child displays a wide range of expressions to show mood?
Your baby’s crying frequency is starting to decrease?
Your baby’s head control increased?
Your baby turns head in all directions while lying on pillows or other types of support
Does your baby have hand-eye coordination?
Does you baby grab objects and shake the object with hands?
Does your baby pull hanging objects and bring them to their mouth?
Does your baby imitate simple actions like opening /closing eyes and sticking out the tongue?
Your child explores face using hands?
Does your baby look at objects and try to put them in mout
Does your child combine gurgles and vocal play?
Does your baby pay attention to sounds of words and listen to adult conversations?
Looks closely while opening and closing own hands.
Does your baby identify and show interest in smelling different kinds of scents?
Your baby reacts excitedly when music starts?
Does your baby smile often?.
Your baby responds positively to touch?
Does your baby sleep around 15 hrs a day? Don’t worry! It’s common.
Your baby’s sleeping,feeding and activities have patterns?
Does your baby roll from front to back?If not, Don’t worry! IT takes time for few babies
Does your baby make vigorous movements like swimming?
Is your baby able to put feet to mouth and suck them?
Does your baby grasp objects without using thumb?
Can your baby hold objects with both hands?
Does your baby reach objects with one or both hands?
Your baby wants to touch , grab, shake and taste objects?
Your baby drop objects but still not able to pick up?
Can you see your baby do more deliberate movements such as extending arms and hands when seeing a desired object?
Is your observant of object’s height and weight?
Is your baby interested in producing and imitating new sounds?
Might direct sounds toward nearby people, objects and toys.
Does your baby have eye-body coordination ?
Does your baby deliberately turn head towards an object?
Does your baby enjoy bath time and lift  head when lying on their back?
Is your baby’s feeding and sleeping schedules increasingly established?
Does your baby engage with other people?
Does your baby actively look around in a new place,exploring surroundings?
Does your baby cry when the playtime is over?
Is your baby smart enough to learn that parents and caregivers respond to crying and use it to get attention?
Does your baby have core strength?
Is your baby able to lift chest up with arms when prone?
Is your baby able to stay in sitting position for a few seconds?
Turns head freely in both directions.
Your baby always uses a single arm to reach for something rather than using both?.
Does your baby grasp objects with the center of the palm without using thumb?
Is your baby able to quickly reach out and grab an object of interest?
Does your baby have enough grip to lift self from lying down to seated?
May have strong enough grip to lift self from lying down to seated while holding onto a stick being lifted by a caregiver.
Does your baby mimic you and other simple sounds?
Your baby is able to remain alert for nearly two continuous hours?
Does your baby recognize frequently used objects or toys?
Does your baby understand the difference between a human face and non human objects?
Your baby leans down to look for an object that is dropped?
Does your baby recognize immediate family and get upset with strangers?
Did your baby improve from gurgles to babbling?
Does your baby repeat dimple sounds like ba,ca,da just to hear them?
Does your baby display a variety of changes in volume and tone when talking?
Did the hand-eye coordination improve of your baby?
Is your baby visually track fast-moving objects?
Your baby is able to hold the bottle with one or two hands?.
Does your baby sleep throughout the night?
Does your baby have mood swings?i.e switches between happiness,fussiness and sadness
Does your baby remain seated for limited periods of time using own arms as support?
Is your baby able to roll over, turn and pivot in all directions?
Starts moving using army crawl (not all babies do it).
Is your baby able to turn and then reach out to grab an object?
Your baby has strong control of head movements?
Radial Palmar Grasp: Objects are secured using the radial side of the palm, the thumb, the index and middle fingers  all other fingers remain flexed.
Does your baby clap hands?(it usually happens between 6-9 months)
Is your baby able to manipulate ,hit and take objects to their mouth?
Your baby has a high level interest in toys that produce sounds like bells,music boxes and rattles?
At this age, Your baby recognizes own name and reacts when being called?
Your baby might be able to use a toy as a tool to grab another one?
Examines objects for a long period of time?
Does your baby explore body with hands and mouth?
Does your baby repeat the same sound like ‘mama,baba’?
Is your baby able to contol the opening and closing of vical tract?.
Is your baby able to differentiate when the objects are near or far?
Does your baby enjoy playing the food and shows interest in feeding self with fingers?
Does your baby understand the word 'NO' ?
Does your baby get excited when he/she realizes that it is playtime?
Does your baby interact with his/her own image in the mirror?
Your baby displays happiness in enjoyable situations?
Is it becoming difficult for you to get things done by the baby?
Does your baby display good balance while sitting without the support of arms ?
Does your baby rock and bounce while sitting?
Your child attempts to get up on hands and knees to get into a crawling position?
Can your baby hold objects with two hands simultaneously and bang them together?
Your baby uses index and middle fingers to get to nearby objects?
Your baby experiments with hands by moving in different directions and dropping objects?
Is your baby curious about people and focuses when they are talking?
Your baby recognizes name and reacts when called?
Does your baby repeat the same sound multiple times before moving to another?
Does your baby experiment with taking turns to talk ,as if having an actual two person conversation?
Your baby has curiosity and pays attention to subtle sounds like ticking of a clock?
Your baby begins to develop strong preferences for different food tastes?
Your baby shows interest in playing for longer periods of time?
Does your baby wave goodbye? This happens between 7-10 Months.
Your baby shows separation anxiety by fear of strangers or separation from mother?
Does your baby cry when others are crying or imitate someone’s mood?
Your baby pushes away something which is unwanted to them?
Is your baby able to sit from a lying position,facee up or face down?
Your baby can remain in seating position for several minutes without using support?
Once in standing position. Does your baby require help to go back to sitting position?
Can your baby stand using furniture as support but still can’t stand up without help?
Your baby grasps objects using index finger ,middle finger and thumb?
Is your baby able to grab and manipulate two objects one in each hand?
Is your baby interested in different forms of face i.e happy face, sad face etc?
Can your baby solve small sequence of actions or behaviours (for eg.kicking a hanging toy to be able to grab it?)
Does your baby attempts to imitate sounds or noises produced by objects? Eg. boom!
Your baby started combining more than one syllable while babbling?
Your baby listens carefully to conversations,songs and understands the different tones?
Is your baby easily distracted and is more interested in exploring surroundings than in things like eating?
Your baby performs actions to get applauded?
Does your child become proactive about starting playtime?
Your baby becomes possessive over a toy?
Does your child understand people’s moods?
Does your child deliberately choose toys with which to play?
Your baby prefers to play close to mother?
Your baby starts using furniture to try to stand but still needs help?’
Does your baby crawl (happens between 8-10 months)
Does your baby go from crawling to sitting position without any effort?
Is your baby able to hold 2 small objects in one hand?
Voluntarily drops objects, although lacks control to place objects on a surface gently?
Can your baby open drawers and explore contents?
Does your child use hands in different ways i.e uses one for support and another to manipulate an object?
Uses hands in different ways  for example, uses one as support and the other to manipulate an object.
Your child stacks similar objects i.e plastic cups?
Is your baby able to recover an object that has been hidden as he/she observes?
Your child anticipates a reward for the successful completion of a taskor order?
Is your baby able to hold several ideas in mind such as communicating while playing?
Your baby gets easily bored with playing with the same toy or same game?
Your child becomes aware of heights, which might create fear?
More sophisticated form of babbling instead of repeating the same syllable?
Your child says “NO’” while shaking head side to side?
Your baby understands individuality within a group?
While getting dressed, your baby helps by moving hands and legs accordingly?
Increased awareness of self  increasingly aware of social approval or disapproval.
Your child imitates gestures,facial expressions and sounds?
Your baby displays a broader set of moods like frustrated,sad,happy,angry,excited etc.?
Your baby picks one or few toys as favourite ones?
Your child demonstrates far in new places?
Your baby tries to place one foot in front of the other to move?
Your baby sits from standing  and is able to move from standing up to sitting on the floor?
Will try to stand up in different ways, using different types of support.
YOUR BABY HAS PERFECT CRAWLING WITH IMPROVED SPEED AND FORM?
Your baby climbs onto and off the chairs and other furniture?
Pincer Grasp. grasps small objects using the tips of the index finger and thumb.
Your child places and removes them from a cup,box etc?
Able to remove a loose top from a container.
Your baby tries to turn pages in a cardboard children’s book,often turning more than one page at a time?
Your baby seeks and reaches for an object that is behind without needing to see it?
Continues to learn about objects and their properties?
Your baby understands object names ie. when you say ball, they look at it?
Is your baby able to understand some simple instructions?
Your child can imitate the rhythm of a conversation and facia; expressions?
Your baby is increasingly interested in playing and exploring the world ?
Imitates movements and games of other children and adults.
Your baby searches for images of nearby objects in the mirror?
Does your baby enjoy peek-a-boo style games?
Increased dependence on mother?(separation anxiety can be high in next 4-8 months).
Your baby might deliberately decide not to cooperate sometimes?
Your baby is able to walk around holding onto furniture?
Your baby might be able to let go of support and remain standing(between 11 and 13 months)
Your child is able to walk steadily while holding as adults’s hand?(between 11 and 13 months)
Able to walk steadily while holding an adult 's  hand (between months 11 and 13).
is your baby able to assemble things better ?i.e building blocks?
Your child uses his mouth or armpit to hold a third object when their hands are full with other objects?
Does your child point to body parts when asked?
Does your baby use objects to achieve goals? (for eg. uses a small chair as a walker and moves around holding it?)
Your baby’s babbling starting to be more conversational?
Is your baby able to pronounce small words through imitation?
Can your child take off socks on his/her own?
Baby’s curiosity and need for independence increased?
Displays many emotions and recognizes them when displayed by other people.
your baby enjoys playing with water in the sink or during bath time?
Is your child very interested in any activity performed by an adult?
Does your baby react strongly when separated from mother , especially in new places?
Your baby is taking his/her first steps without support?(between 12 and 15 months)
Is your baby able to walk a few steps on toes using furniture?
Is your baby able to rotate chest 90 degrees while standing up?
Can go from standing up to a sitting position without difficulty.
Even if able to walk, might prefer crawling as a more efficient way of locomotion for a while.
Is your baby able to crawl with one hand raised or while carrying an object?
Can your child firmly hold a crayon in his/her hand?
Is your baby able to hold thin objects and manipulate them like placing them in bottles etc?
Can your baby group items? Eg. similar shapes such as square, circle etc.
Did your child’s imitation skills improve?
Understands simple orders.
Is your baby able to say words while pointing towards them?
Can say about three words and understands many more.
Can your baby imitate lyrics or musical sounds of favourite songs?
Did your baby start doing more things alone?
does your child remain alone for longer periods? Eg. After waking up, the baby takes a few minutes to call their parents?
Your baby can communicate his/her desires and needs effectively?
your baby can stand without assistance for longer periods?
Walks alone short distances with irregular unstable steps (between months 13-16).
Your child climbs stairs by crawling with much more ease?
Is your child interested in climbing onto cushions or low tables?
Does your baby like to move around pushing objects like chairs because they provide an increased sense of stability?
Is able to remove the lid from a container when it is low pressure.
when given a crayon, can your baby make a few marks on the paper?
Does your baby interact with objects to learn more from them?
Enjoys Experiment- Based Play.  “What happens if...?” For example, “What happens if I splash water out of the tub?”.
Does your baby have interest in parts of the body i.e exploring eyes,mouth and ears?
Your baby combines familiar actions and words? Eg. bye-bye while waving goodbye?
Does your baby understand a broader range of simple instructions ,especially if they are accompanied by gestures?
Did your child begin to perceive language as a powerful tool to interact with others?
Can your baby eat with a spoon although he/she will spill a lot?
Can your baby take off socks,hat and other items that are easily removable?
Your child learns to ask for help and uses limited vocabulary to communicate?
Your baby feels as if the world revolves around them?
Play is the primary mechanism by which he/she explores and relates to the world around her.
Your baby wants to do everything independently but realises that he/she still needs help?
Does your baby able to roll the ball towards a target with moderate accuracy?
Is your child able to incorporate other movements while walking?
Does your baby attempt to throw a ball overhead?
Your baby walks in an unstable fashion ,frequently falling down and standing back up?
your child turns pages in a book,usually 4,5 pages at once?
Can your baby grab objects as they move slowly?(like ball,car)
Can your child build towers of two levels with increasing ease and various types of objects?
Does your baby have preferences of objects or things?
Does your baby use ‘tools’ to grab objects that are out of reach?
Child’s capacity to imitate is increasingly sophisticated  imitates some basic  facial and verbal expressions and some animal and objects sounds.
Can your child recognize frequently visited locations like parks etc?
your baby understands more than 20-30 words?
Are you able to observe the increased desire of your child to communicate ,although limited by small vocabulary?
Applies inflections to new words, for example, may raise the tone of voice when asking a question. “more?”.
The majority of the words the child understands are simple and concrete.Can also understand simple actions like, “Let’s dance”.
Frequent use of the word “no” in different contexts.
Your baby is now able to suck through a straw?
Your child can pull out his/her own arms and legs while putting on clothes?
your child manifests a lot of emotions?
Is your baby preferring familiar people and causing anxiety when exposed to strangers?
Can your child entertain himself/herself for a few minutes?
Separation from mom still causes anxiety, this will start decreasing at some point in the next four months.
Your child tries to share positive and negative emotions?
Does your baby squat while walking?
Is your baby able to squat while picking something up, then stand again and continue walking?
Can your baby roll a ball to you and receive it when you roll back?
Is your child able to carry objects from one place to another while walking and does this at every opportunity?
Is your baby able to anticipate? Like begins to anticipate the trajectory of certain objects?
Your child is able to explain how much quantity is required?
Does your baby imitate social behaviours when he/she frequently observes such as clean,sweep etc?
Ability to Anticipate.can begin to anticipate the trajectory of certain objects  knows where a ball will bounce or what direction a toy car will roll.
Initial Notions of the Concept of Quantity. for example, more bread or more water.
Physical development as well as development of other areas allow him/her to imitate social behaviors he/she frequently observes around him/her, such as sweep or clean.
Knows the various steps of each daily routine (bathing, nap time, supper, etc.).
your child uses inexact word imitation as a mechanism for language learning?
Is your baby able to verbally communicate many needs?
Is there an increase in intonation and pitch in babbling?
Can your baby understand facial gestures or body movements?
Can your baby drink from a cup with no lid with assistance?
Your child attempts to comb or brush his own hair?
your baby enjoy getting different reactions from those around him/her?
Your child is more open to sharing with adults than other children?
Your baby remembers social routines and behaviours such as hello or goodbye?
is your baby able to throw a ball with an overhead motion?
Can your child change walking speed due to better control of movements?
Can your baby climb furniture alone?
Is your baby able to lift one foot for a moment if leaning on a piece of furniture?
Is your baby able to walk backwards for a few steps?
can your child rip a piece of paper?
Is he/she able to press low pressure lids onto circular containers?
Can he/she guide a toy car or similar toy back and forth on a path?
is he/she able to point to a majority of main parts of the body?
Can your child follow and obey more complex one step commands?
Your child attempts to say the names of close relatives?
Is your baby able to pronounce names like dada,mama,meema and popop?
Your baby shows interest in brushing teeth?
Is your child able to pick up toys if you ask?
Your child initiated some social games with mom or dad such as passing a ball back and forth?
Your baby displays limited patience ?(will easily throw a tantrum if not given what he/she wants)
Your baby laughs hysterically at things which baby finds cheerful or funny?
your child climbs stairs holding your hand on one side and hand rail on other?
While walking, your child can make a sudden change of direction with more ease?
Does your child show increased interest in climbing sofas,chairs, and other furniture?
Did your child develop the ability to independently stack rings on ring stacking toy?
When drawing or painting on a large surface,does your child use the entire arm?
your child associates familiar people with their respective names?
Can your baby identify major parts of the body?
his/her vocabulary is starting to increase such as thank you or come?
Your child adds the use of the word “Yes” to their vocabulary?
Your child uses the word ‘mama’ deliberately and proactively to get your attention?
can your baby use a fork with certain types of food?
Can your baby drink from a cup without a lid on their own?
Increasingly helps undress themselves, pulling out their arms as you hold his shirt sleeves or lifting each foot as you pull off the pants.
Your baby begins to understand basic courtesies such as  saying “thank you”.
Gross motor-Is your child able to walk in different directions when necessary?
Does your child climb up and down stairs holding your hand on one side and handrail on the other?
Is your baby able to walk fast and run short distances?
Does your baby place and remove lids of containers?
Does your child draw vertical lines?(usually happens between 18 and 20 months)
Is your baby able to build three four towers of blocks without assistance?
Does your child have a basic understanding of spatial location of objects such as above,below,inside or outside?
Does your child have the capacity to imitate sounds and words that he/she hears?
Does your baby have attention to stories or rhymes?
his/her vocabulary has a range of 10-20 words?.
Did your child begin to combine words or repeat words?
Does your baby have echolalia ?(i.e repetition of a word or a phrase several times)
can your child wash his/her own hands?
does your child enjoy his/her favourite games in the company of familiar adults?.
Can your baby play by himself/herself for a few minutes without the presence of a parent?
Interested in actions that solicit a response and social interaction (e.g., give and take games).
Struggles to share toys with playmates.
Kick the Ball.can kick a ball with some precision.
Improved coordination and balance allows dancing with some control and falling less frequently when walking.
Able to jump in place with both feet at once.
Is able to throw a ball progressively farther.
Turns pages in books with thin pages, usually two or three pages at once.
Can unwrap some small objects combining various fine motor skills and the ability to tear paper.
Able to string beads with medium sized holes on to a firm cable.
Associates Objects with Activities.  for example, knows that soap and towel are used at bath time.
Once completing an objective (e.g., finishing a basic puzzle), will repeat it  several times, which helps reinforce learning.
Initial Short Phrases. begins to use frequently heard two- or three-word phrases.
Says “yes” and “no” with more purpose.
First phrases include the minimum number of necessary words to make himself understood  (telegraphic language).
Can pull up or pull off pants with elastic bands.
Capable of bringing a spoon to mouth with greater precision.
During the next few months, tantrums can increase, which may sometimes make mealtime, bathtime and other selfCare routines more difficult.
Enjoys Dancing. uses dancing to express happiness and gain social acceptance.
Aware of the presence of other children (still prefers to play alone).
Experiences a broader range of emotions (tantrums and biting can result from these new sensations).
Need for independence will cause him to increasingly try things on his own.
Runs Short Distances.can run short distances with imprecise movements.
Walks forward, backward and sideways , with ease  still struggles to do so on a narrow surface.
Can climb up stairs using support on one hand only, needs support on both sides when climbing down stairs.
Balance while walking continues to improve  can carry larger items without falling.
Drawing Horizontal Lines. attempts to imitate horizontal lines (between months 20 and 22).
Shape Puzzle.can complete a basic shape (square, triangle and circle) puzzle without assistance.
Can open and close zippers.
Play based on Mental Representations.e.g., uses a box to represent a toy car, plays by moving it and making corresponding car sounds.
Starts to understand that the reflection in the mirror is not another baby but rather himself.
Motor skills, ability to imitate and spatial awareness allow her to replicate a variety of body movements during playtime or while dancing.
Decreased reliance on gestures and noises, as his repertoire of words increases.
Combines words and body language to make herself better understood.
Continues to use the same word in various forms. For example, will use the word wa-wa   for water, juice or milk.
Has the ability to use a spoon (to eat solid and semi-liquid food), a fork and drink from a cup with no lid.
Able to help with low complexity household chores (e.g., clean up something that spilled).
Imitates social behaviors of emotion and conduct, such as forms of celebration and dancing.
Incorporates concepts like “mine” and “want” in social interactions motivated by his desire for independence.
Demonstrates pride and pleasure upon completing an objective.
Episodes of frustration start to become more frequent.
Uses available toys to recreate desired adventures (such as playing with a toy plane as it could fly).
Jumping Down.can jump down from a low height.
Kicks a ball, follows it and kicks it again, , consecutively several times.
Changes speed, stops and starts again , with greater ease while walking.
Towers of Four to Six Blocks. is able to build towers of four to six blocks (between months 21 and 24).
Capable of turning round-shaped doorknobs.
Classify into Two Groups. is able to separate objects into two groups based on some characteristic such as size, color or shape.
Concept of Size. has a basic understanding of the concept of size.
Primary Colors. is able to identify some colors, usually the primary colors.
Spatial Awareness. expanded comprehension of the spatial location of objects and himself (in front of or behind  above or below).
Understands the concept of possessive pronouns like “mine”   and   “yours”.
Uses two- and three-word phrases with some (still limited) frequency.
Vocabulary and ability to pronounce some words clearly continues to improve on a daily basis.
Reduced Separation Anxiety.able to endure short spans of separation more easily.
Able to spend more time with other kids, though not proactively interacting with them.
More open to socializing with adults other than immediate family.
Plays at imitating observed adult behaviors, for example, pretending to talk on the phone.
Tests limits and rules set by parents by engaging in defiant behavior.
Wide Range of Motor Movements. navigates obstacles with increasing ease  for example, climbing over, under or walking sideways to overcome them.
Able to climb up and down stairs with only one hand on the handrail (but likes to get support in both hands).
When dancing, can speed up or slow down the body movements, depending on the rhythm of the music.
Runs more frequently, does it in a straight line and have difficulty stopping suddenly.
Drawing Circles.attempts to imitate circular and semi-circular lines (between months 22 and 24).
Able to roll a ball with higher accuracy due to better hand and finger control.
Day and Night.starts to understand the concept of day and night (which provides the foundation to eventually understand the concept of time).
Formation of Numerical Concepts. understands the quantitative difference between one and many.
Identifies basic shapes (e.g., square, circle, etc) when you mention them.
Uses Plurals. in some words or short phrases.
Vocabulary. repertoire includes around , 25-35 words.
Enjoys repeating any word or phrase that she finds interesting or funny.
Babbling starts to diminish.
Participates more actively in bathing routine, helping lather soap, wash down and dry off.
Tries to use napkins by herself.
With a little help, is able to peel some easy-to-peel fruits, such as a banana.
Increased ability to express emotions (including demonstrations of affection and frustration).
Likes to help you with frequently observed activities (e.g., if he sees you sweeping, he wants to do it too).
Likes to share interesting things with you and will take you to them to show them to you.
Kick a Moving Ball.can kick a ball that is moving slowly towards him.
Jump in Place.continues to try, feet barely leave the floor.
Ability to run improves  some children can change direction rather than run only in a straight line.
Folding Paper. if shown how, can fold a sheet of paper in half.
Has the ability to manipulate small objects (e.g., can open a candy wrapper).
Imitates several types of line drawing, but grip on the crayon continues to develop over several months.
Colors. identifies favorite colors in nearby objects.
Recognizes some simple shapes upon holding them, without looking at them (a ball versus a cube).
Memorizes parts of favorite songs.
Starts to identify people outside of the nuclear family by name.
Capacity to imitate words improves greatly  can imitate simple new words immediately after hearing them.
Says her name to refer to herself.
Can eat a variety of foods using utensils without assistance.
Able to undress himself with minimum assistance.
Capable of washing and drying hands with minimal help from you.
Increasingly enjoys the company of other children .
Laughs with people as a mechanism for integration and social acceptance.
Desire for independence continues, but continues to demand your constant attention.
Displays egocentric behaviors centered on his needs and wants.
Climb Stairs Without Help.
Able to climb into a ride-on toy car and push herself along with her feet.
First attempts to jump forward with both  feet (hop forward).
Turning Pages of a Book turns the pages in a book or magazine one by one.
Can copy vertical, horizontal and  circular lines (this skill with gradually improve over several months).
Can complete a simple shape puzzle  even when shapes are mixed up and reversed.
Two-Step Commands.comprehends and executes instructions containing two or in some cases, three steps.
Has a better understanding of the parts of the body, recognizes them and knows their function.
Thinking Before Acting.the child capacity to form symbolic thoughts, allows him to think through and anticipate the consequences of his actions rather than acting impulsively.
Her focus changes from exploring an object itself to understanding its functionality.
Vocabulary.comprehends between 150 and 300 words and can use 50 or more of them (varies widely from child to child).
Phrases of Three or Four Words. Begins to use phrases made of three or four words.
Attempts to combine phrases, pausing , between one phrase and the next.
Word repertoire includes familiar people , objects and several animals.
Able to comb or brush her own hair with minimal help from you.
Tries to use a spoon to consume liquid or foods, although still spills much of it.
Is capable of putting on some types of shoes (without laces and easy to slide into) .
Presence of Parallel Play. plays alongside children but not with them.
Open to sharing space with other children, sometimes even sharing toys.
Means to express emotions extend from actions to facial expressions.
Although her sense of independence  continues to expand, she still has no concept of danger.
